definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: Machu Picchu was built in the classical Inca style, with polished dry-stone walls.
sentences.chinese: 马丘比丘的建筑具有印加传统风格，抛光干石墙。

sentences.english: The next day the Espinar water strike spreads to communities near Machu Picchu.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，埃斯皮纳水罢工扩大到马丘比丘附近的社区。

sentences.english: The ruins of Machu Picchu are one of the most beautiful and mysterious ancient sites in the world.
sentences.chinese: 马丘比丘废墟是世界上最美最神秘的古代遗址之一。

sentences.english: Take a 90 degree turn at the mountain ridge of Machu Picchu and to see the outline of a human face.
sentences.chinese: 把马丘比丘的山脊线左转90度，像人类脸孔的侧面。

sentences.english: Machu Picchu, the "Lost city of the Incas".
sentences.chinese: 马丘比丘，“印加文明失落的城市”。

sentences.english: Steep, thatched roofs were typical of the residences in Machu Picchu.
sentences.chinese: 在马丘比丘，居民房顶一般陡峭，由茅草盖成。

definition: Angkor Wat, temple complex in Cambodia
Andes mountain chain of South America
Uluru, massive sandstone outcrop in central Australia

pinyin: Qi3 li4 ma3 zha1 luo2 shan1

definition: Lake Bled, glacial lake amid the Julian Alps in Slovenia, adjacent to the town of Bled
Mt Cook on New Zealand South Island, national park and highest peak
